newsitem.title: USA: Tourism contributes $4.4 bln a year to Mississippi.
newsitem.headline: Tourism contributes $4.4 bln a year to Mississippi.

text.p: Tourism pumps $4.4 billion annually into Mississippi's economy, the Tupelo Daily Journal said Monday.
Tourism is the state's third-biggest industry, behind agriculture and health care. Without gaming, the figure drops to $2.26 billion a year.
The data were released state Department of Economic and Community Devlopment to coincide with this week's observation of National Tourism Week.
